name: K2-308
scenarioDescription:
The K2-308 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-308 is a star with 1.09 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.24 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

K2-308 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-308 system


K2-308 b

K2-308 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-308 b is 70.596 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-308 b is 9.916 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-308 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-308, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
